account.externalId.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
account.externalId.name: account.externalId

account.internalId.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
account.internalId.name: account.internalId

account.name.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
account.name.name: account.name

address.description: NetSuite inserts the address of the payee from the payee record. To enable or disable the Auto Fill preference, go to <_TABNAME=TRAN_USERPREFS_> > Set Preferences.If you want, you can change it here for just this transaction by typing up to five rows of information.
address.name: address

balance.description: This field is returned in an advanced search only. Note that in your advanced search you must set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false.
balance.name: balance

billPay.description: Check this box to send this check online.You must follow the set up procedure in How Do I Set Up Online Bill Pay before you can use this feature.The NetSuite basic package includes a set number of bill pay transactions. Click the Charges may apply link for more information.
billPay.name: billPay

currency.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Currencies. (Note that the Multiple Currencies feature must be enabled before you can set currency values.) This value sets the currency that all transactions involving this customer are conducted in. If defaults are OFF, this field is required. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
currency.externalId.name: currency.externalId

currency.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Currencies. (Note that the Multiple Currencies feature must be enabled before you can set currency values.) This value sets the currency that all transactions involving this customer are conducted in. If defaults are OFF, this field is required. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
currency.internalId.name: currency.internalId

currency.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Currencies. (Note that the Multiple Currencies feature must be enabled before you can set currency values.) This value sets the currency that all transactions involving this customer are conducted in. If defaults are OFF, this field is required. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
currency.name.name: currency.name

department.externalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
department.name.name: department.name

exchangeRate.description: Defaults to the exchange rate associated with the value selected for currency.
exchangeRate.name: exchangeRate

landedCostPerLine.description: Check this box if you want to specify the landed cost per line item.
landedCostPerLine.name: landedCostPerLine

memo.description: If you want, enter a memo. What you enter here will print on the memo line of the check.
memo.name: memo

subsidiary.externalId.description: If you use NetSuite OneWorld, the Subsidiary field defaults to the primary subsidiary associated with the Payee.Note: If you share vendor records with multiple subsidiaries, you can change the subsidiary from the primary subsidiary to a secondary subsidiary. Changing the subsidiary updates the bank account to that of the selected subsidiary, updates the currency to that of the new bank, and clears the lines on the Expenses and Items subtabs.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: If you use NetSuite OneWorld, the Subsidiary field defaults to the primary subsidiary associated with the Payee.Note: If you share vendor records with multiple subsidiaries, you can change the subsidiary from the primary subsidiary to a secondary subsidiary. Changing the subsidiary updates the bank account to that of the selected subsidiary, updates the currency to that of the new bank, and clears the lines on the Expenses and Items subtabs.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: If you use NetSuite OneWorld, the Subsidiary field defaults to the primary subsidiary associated with the Payee.Note: If you share vendor records with multiple subsidiaries, you can change the subsidiary from the primary subsidiary to a secondary subsidiary. Changing the subsidiary updates the bank account to that of the selected subsidiary, updates the currency to that of the new bank, and clears the lines on the Expenses and Items subtabs.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

tax2Total.description: Here, NetSuite enters the total amount of PST based on the line items you enter below.
tax2Total.name: tax2Total

taxTotal.description: Here, NetSuite enters the total amount of GST based on the line items you enter below.
taxTotal.name: taxTotal

toBePrinted.description: If you want to save this in a queue of checks to print, check this box.Otherwise, to save and print this check now, you can click Save & Print.
toBePrinted.name: toBePrinted

tranDate.description: NetSuite inserts today's date for the posting date of this check. You can type or pick another date.What you enter here determines the date range in which this transaction appears on the Bank register.You can select or enter custom date ranges on registers.
tranDate.name: tranDate

tranId.description: NetSuite automatically fills this field.If you checked the To Be Printed box, this field autofills with To Print. You choose starting numbers when you print those checks.If you are immediately printing this check, NetSuite increases the largest check number by one. You can type another number here, but the next number reverts to the standard pattern.You can also use this field to record ACH, ATM, or other reference numbers.
tranId.name: tranId

transactionNumber.description: This field displays the system-generated number for this transaction type.
transactionNumber.name: transactionNumber

type.value.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
type.value.name: type.value

userTotal.description: You can enter the dollar amount of the check, but NetSuite will update this amount as you add or edit line items.
userTotal.name: userTotal
